COPY NO. !WAR cabinet supply AND PRODUCTIONCIVIL DEFENCE REPORT NO. 6.REPORT BY THE MINISTER OF HOME security for FEBRUARY. 1940.(Previous Report W.P. (R) (40) 54)1. Progress with Civil Defence Supplies was in themain satisfactory this month.2. Steel shelter distribution has been delayed owingto weather conditions. The Railway Companies were unable fora time to accept shelters for delivery in the Midland andNorthern areas and as a consequence the flow of supplies fromthe manufacturers was stopped for one week. 2,200,000 sheltershave been issued to date.3. The bulk of the requirements of Protective Equipment ;has now been met. The issue of anti-gas helmets andrespirators for babies and young children was completed thismonth.4. Approximately 90% of the pumping Units for the auxiliary Fire Service have now been supplied. The Hoseposition is still not satisfactory, but larger supplies from france have now been contracted for.5. The position of supplies for the Emergency hospital services is.satisfactory.J.A.Whitehall.8th March, 1940.
